DESCRIPTION:
Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

This 2019 Exceptional Single Cask from Macallan (2019/ESH – 14812/01) was distilled on the 20th of October 1997, matured for over 21 years in European Oak Refill Sherry Hogshead and was bottled on the 2nd of September 2019.  This is one of a very limited production of only 198 bottles.  This is another stunning single cask from Macallan.

Cask Number 433 has "aromas of vanilla, mango, raspberry, barley sugar and lavender, leading to flavours of cranachan, lemon, floral notes, marzipan and faint spice, with citrus, ripe fruit and oak."
One of only 280 bottles released from Rosebank distillery in 2020 comes to this 27-year-old single cask. It was matured in a refill bourbon barrel and was part of a ballot to 100 members of the public. 
Rosebank has been doing very well at auction of late and this may be attributed to restoration of the distillery getting underway in November 2019.

This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world. The 2018 series was made available for Asia and the USA. The series originated from some single cask bottlings in the 90's that are described at some of the greatest Macallans of them all. 
This bottling has the reference is 2018/ESH-14369/11 and is one of only 228 bottles.
It was distilled on the 13th of October 1997 and bottles 21+ years later. It was matured in a single Sherry hogshead made from European Oak. Steven Bremner selected this cask and was the 11th cask to be reserved for the 2018 series on 6th July 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Masters of Photography Steven Klein Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Masters of Photography Steven Klein Edition is the 6th release in an already extremely sough-after series.
"Klein's vision and creativity is embodied further by The Masters of Photography: Steven Klein Edition Whisky. Limited to only 1,000 bottles worldwide, it is a single malt of stand-out quality that captures an ultimate The Macallan moment."
Charlie MacLean awarded this whisky 9/10.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Yamazaki - 18 Year Old Mizunara Oak 2017 Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Mizunara oak is very rare, especially when combined with 18 year old malt from the oldest whisky distillery in Japan. 
This expression was created by Shinji Fukuyo who is Suntory’s chief blender.
It comes in a beautifully carved case that was once used to house Suntory whisky. 
It's hugely complex and has a very unique Japanese profile with a long-lasting finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 25 Year Old Anniversary Malt (1975) Bottled 2000
DESCRIPTION: This is an incredibly rare 25 year old Speyside single malt.  It was distilled at The Macallan in 1975.  It was bottled in 2000 for the highly decorated Anniversary Malt range. This a 70cl bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 37 Year Old - 1978 16th Annual Release
DESCRIPTION:
From one of Scotland’s lost distilleries, this Port Ellen is a very rare release and soon will be even more sought after when the distillery reopens. This is from Diageo’s yearly release of Port Ellen. It was distilled in 1978 and is 37 Years Old. This is an individually numbered bottle and is one of only 2,940 bottles produced. This lot comes with the original presentation box.
This is bottle number 1980.

Tobermory had been temporarily closed for almost four decades.
It was rejuvenated and brought back to life in 1972.
This vintage has been bottled at 42 years old and comes from the rebirth of Tobermory/Ledaig.
Copper was taken from the old stills that produced the very spirit within the bottle is what makes up the card included within the presentation box.
A very rare and highly collectable 1977 vintage Laphroaig.  Bottled in the spring of 1995 in very limited quantities. This is a 75cl bottling.

This series is widely recognised as one of the most collectable not just among Macallan fanatics but whisky enthusiasts all around the world. The 2018 series was made available for Asia and the USA. The series originated from some single cask bottlings in the 90's that are described at some of the greatest Macallans of them all.
This particular bottling was distilled on the 24th October 2001 and laid to mature nicely or exceptionally in an American Oak Sherry cask #ASP-6355/04.
It was eventually bottled on the 2nd of September 2019 and is one of 576 bottles.  This cask was specially selected by Mr Bremner one of the Macallan Whisky makers.

The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Daftmill - 2006 Winter, Berry Bro, RMW & Luvians
DESCRIPTION:
Well...where do you start with this exceptional lot and opportunity to own some of the hardest to find Daftmills.
Daftmill - A family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife. Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.
Winter 2006 - The third release and a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels. 46% ABV
Berry Bro's & Rudd -  Bottled exclusively for Berry Bros & Rudd in 2019 this lowland whisky is quite possibly their most sought after expression yet with only 621 bottles produced. 57.4% ABV
Royal Mile Whiskies - This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV. The cask yielded just 231 bottles meaning there is limited opportunity to buy and taste this much sought after whisky. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies. 56% ABV
Luvians - A First fill bourbon barrel #89 and was filled on 29th December 2006. One of 230 bottles.

Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

Part of the 2017 releases of the Exceptional Single Cask range from the most sought after distillery in the world, Macallan. 
Chosen by one of the master distillers, Sarah Burgess and made available to only the USA and Asia. The European Sherry Oak cask was laid down on the 18th of May 2005 and eventually bottled at its cask strength 63.4%.
Only 552 bottles were produced and filled on the 20th Dec 2017.

Distilled on the 31st December 1968 (Hogmanay for us Scots). A rare and limited edition Bunnahabhain which was bottled in 2002.  
93 points from Serge Valentin on WhiskyFun.com making highly acclaimed amongst whisky experts.
Only 2,002 bottles released...

The Brora 38 Year Old was released in 2016 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?

The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak is a highly collectable bottling. This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. It was bottled at the Whisky Tint of 24!
This lot includes a full set of the Macallan Travel Series: 1920s, 1930s 1940s & 1950s, each in their presentation boxes. 4 x 50cl.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.
 
UK duty stamped.

The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

The Brora 37 Year Old was released in 2015 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
This is bottle number 239.

These whiskies are usually known for their Premier cru of Single Malt Scotch. They are said to be elegant, fruity malts which usually have a drying smokiness.
Braes of Glenlivet - Distilled in 1975 and bottled in June 2008. 43% ABV.
Mannochmore - Distilled in 1994 and biottled in 2014. 46% ABV.
Glenlossie - Distilled in 1995 and bottled in 2013. 46% ABV.
Clynelish - Distilled in 1996 and bottled in 2013. 46% ABV.
Strathmill - Distilled in 2002 and bottled in 2016. 46% ABV.
Aberfeldy - Distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2015. 46% ABV.

The Brora 35 Year Old was released in 2014 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.  Aged in a combination of refill American and European oak, this has the classic Brora waxiness.
 
This is bottle number 0763.

The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

This single cask (#8167/02) was distilled on 9th September 2002 and matured in a European oak sherry puncheon for 15 years, before being bottled at cask strength on 2nd May 2018 at 60.1% ABV.
Selected for the series by Macallan Whisky Maker Sarah Burgess, this expression is limited to just 627 bottles making it a highly collectable bottle.

This single cask (#8167/02) was distilled on 9th September 2002 and matured in a European oak sherry puncheon for 15 years, before being bottled at cask strength on 2nd May 2018 at 60.1% ABV.
Selected for the series by Macallan Whisky Maker Sarah Burgess, this expression is limited to just 627 bottles making it a highly collectable bottle.

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This Highland single malt from the closed distillery, Brora, is 24 years old and bottled at cask strength (56.1%)
This is bottle number 3379.

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

In 2017 Macallan released a 15 Year Old Gran Reserva and it has been highly sought after since. The single malt features whisky matured predominantly in specially selected first-fill European oak sherry seasoned casks.
Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

In 2017 Macallan released a 15 Year Old Gran Reserva and it has been highly sought after since. The single malt features whisky matured predominantly in specially selected first-fill European oak sherry seasoned casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 1980 21 Year Old  - Single Cask #8421
DESCRIPTION: A single cask of 1980 vintage Highland Park bottled in commemoration of a visit from Maxxium UK to the distillery. Distilled on 16th October 1980, matured in a traditional sherry hogshead #8421, selected on Thursday 31st of May ready for bottling on its 21st birthday. This is one of only 252 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - Airigh Nam Beist, Blasda, Alligator & Galileo
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg 1990 Airigh Nam Beist 2006 - Prior to the Galileo, this is one of the few age statement malts that Ardbeg have been producing. It name comes from a Gaelic origin which translates to shelter. Distilled in 1990 it was bottled in 2006 at 46% ABV.
Blasda - Released in 2008, Ardbeg Blasda is a lesser-peated version of many people's favourite Islay malt, being just 8ppm in bottle (as opposed to the standard 10yo's 23ppm). It is described as 'a lighter taste of Islay.' It has hints of sweets and chocolates for a pleasant accompaniment to the mild characteristic Ardbeg peaty tones. After all, 'Blasda' in Gaelic means 'sweet and delicious.' 40% ABV
Alligator Untamed Relese - Aged in a similar style to the Ardbeg 10 year old, apart from the fact that a portion of the whisky was aged in heavily charred barrels. The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name. The Committee Release of Ardbeg Alligator was exceptional and incredibly popular and so was this Untamed Release... 51.2% ABV
Ardbeg Galileo - One of 2012's most eagerly awaited releases. It is made up from casks distilled in 1999, some of which spent their full term of maturation in casks that previously held Marsala wine. This gives sweet tropical fruit flavours to the malt. Galileo's concept is in celebration of the well-publicised experiment whereby small quantities of Ardbeg were sent into space at the end of 2011 to see how they mature in zero gravity. 49% ABV

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - 16 Year Old - Managers Dram 1994 - 200th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This special edition 16-year-old sherry cask whisky was selected in 1994, the 200th anniversary of the Oban distillery.
It is part of the Manager’s Dram series bottled for the employees of Diageo, as it is now known.
The Manager’s Dram selection process was done by each distillery manager on rotation and was bottled at cask strength. John William chose this cask, it was bottled in 1995 from a refill cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 10 Year Old Cask Strength - 1 Litre 58.8%
DESCRIPTION:
The much loved 10 year old Macallan bottled at its cask strength - 58.8%.
Matured in Sherry Oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
The very recognisable Easter Elchie house depicted on the front of the box painted by Sara Middleton.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chichibu - 2011 Single Coedonado Beer Cask #3301 TWE 20th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Opened in 2008 the Chichibu distillery is located in Saitama, Japan. It helped revive the Japanese whisky scene since it was the country’s first new distillery since Hakushu in 1973.
This is an exclusive bottling and single cask was from the distillery and it for The Whisky Exchange's 20th anniversary. It is one of 224 bottles.
It was distilled in 2011 and bottled in 2019. The whisky was matured in cask #3301 (Coedonado beer cask).

Released in 1996 celebrating and commemorating 150 years of Caol Ila, which opened in 1846.
This stunning bottle was only ever given to employees of Diageo.

Hand-selected for Selfridges this cask yielded 200 bottles. Distilled in 2012 and bottled in 2019 from a 2nd refill hogshead, this hyped dram is uncoloured and chill-filtered.
The cask is ex Hanyu before being taken into the care of Chichibu.
Notes: Baked apple, with a creamy, rich layer of Hazelnuts.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 41 Year Old - 1978 Single Cask #11002
DESCRIPTION:
This is a beautifully presented limited edition single Highland malt from Glen Garioch.  It was distilled in 1978, matured in refill bourbon barrel #11002 for 41 years and was bottled in August 2019 at 55.1% ABV. This is one of only 180 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 18.

A port lovers dream from this highland malt giant.
The Dalmore vintage from 1996,1998 and 2001. This lot includes 3 x 70cl bottles.
All are an assemblage of port cask finishes.
Each year only has 300 bottles produced and it is very rare to see all three in one auction. Grab this chance!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chichibu - Single Cask #1173 / Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland 2011
DESCRIPTION:
Only 251 bottles of this Japanese cracker were produced by Chichibu exclusively for Scotland's independent whisky bars.
It has been matured in a first-fill bourbon barrel #1173 and made using Tipple barley.
Bottled in 2019.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Bicentenary Repatriation Japanese Edition 1977
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park Bicentenary release certainly has a great story behind it.
In 1997 it was thought to be sold out but in a warehouse, in Japan, hundreds of the bottles were discovered. 
This was re-released in 2008 and this is one of 690 bottles.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 16 Year Old  - Jutland Memorial 100th Anniversary Edition - Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
A special single cask bottling of Scapa, released in 2016 to commemorate the Battle of Jutland, which occurred in 1916, bottled in a tribute the 249 ships that were involved in the Battle of Jutland. This is one of 249 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 185.
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hibiki - 21 Year Old - Kacho Fugetsu Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Shinjirō Torii started in 1899 as a wine store in Japanese town Osaka and the rest is history for Suntory. They are seen as the founding and leading Japanese influence for Whisky.
Yamazaki was his first venture into the distilling industry and produced grain/malt whisky. After its great success, a second distillery was built and called.....Hakushu. Thank you Mr Torii.
Hibiki is the most popular blend by Suntory which came to the publics lips in 1989 with whiskies from both Yamazaki, Hakushu and the Chita grain whisky. 
This bottling represents the beauty of Japanese nature.

American & European oak cask matured, this is one of the Speyside distilleries oldest age statements to date.
I think we are all aware of the difficult times the distillery has had in the past with multiple closures but since its purchase in 1993 by Gordon and Machail it has done nothing but good things. Striking new labels and brand new designs combined with their golden liquid we hope for more of the same in the future.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date (minus 1), comprising of Edition no.2, 3 ,4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

This is a collectable bottling from Ardbeg.  It was distilled in August 2011 and was matured in a 1st fill bourbon barrel until July 2018. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 60.2% ABV. This is one of just 256 individually numbered bottles produced from cask number 2198.
This is bottle number 210.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Keystones Series - Hobbister, Shiel, Quercus, Yesnaby & Hillhead
DESCRIPTION:
This lot contains 5x 70 cl, Hobbister, Shiel, Quercus, Yesnaby & Hillhead.
There were 1200 bottle released in each series.

This well-aged Glen Grant was specially bottled to celebrate Gordon & MacPhail being awarded The Queen's Award for Enterprise for International Trade and was given to staff.  Distilled in June 1965, it was matured in a first-fill sherry cask and was bottled in August 2009.

Produced for the Feis Ile festival on Islay in 2006. A 1994 vintage Laphroaig and limited edition distillery that produced 600 bottles. 
Distilled in 1994 by the apprentice John Campbell and bottled 12 years later.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 8 Year Old Easter Elchies Seasonal Selection - Summer
DESCRIPTION:
2005-2007 was the year range from which The Easter Elchies Seasonal Selection dates from.
Only 550 bottles of this "Summer" were bottled as an 8 year old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: That Boutique-y Whisky Co - Macallan 28 Year Old - Batch 14 (50cl)
DESCRIPTION:
'That Boutique-y Whisky Company' bottles a variety of well known single malt and single grain whiskies. Instantly recognisable, with their wonderfully colourful labels and comic book style designs, each label tells a hidden story about the distillery the bottle represents.
This very sought after Macallan is well-aged and will be a great buy to any collector.
This is bottle number 107.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 30 Year Old - The Ian Hunter Story - Book 1
DESCRIPTION: This is a 30 year old cask strength bottling from the 1987 vintage. This bottle forms the first chapter to the story of Ian Hunter and celebrates the man who introduced the iconic American white Oak barrels to the whisky making at Laphroaig. It is said that it was Ian who made Laphroaig what it is today.

An older style Highland Park 25 Year Old presented in a round outer box, bottled in the 1990s.  Time spent in first-fill sherry oak contributes to a remarkable flavour profile winner and it was the winner of the Gold at the International Wine and Spirit Competition in 1999.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - Limited Edition and Feis Ile 2015.
DESCRIPTION:
Beautifully presented in this handcrafted case comes two limited edition Lagavulin's and a Feis bottling from 2011.
The 12 rear old was bottled in 2011 and is a limited edition and well-aged after being held in a refill American oak. Said to have a creamy texture and some say a dry finish.
The 8 year old was released in 2016 to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Lagavulin distillery by John Johnston in 1816. This single malt is smoky, with underlying sweet spice. It was inspired by the visit of Alfred Barnard to the distillery in the 1880s when he tried an 'exceptionally fine' eight-year-old from the distillery, making this a very fitting tribute for the milestone occasion.
The Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2015 release was a 24 year old, triple matured malt - aged in bourbon casks, px sherry casks and old oak puncheons. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.9%. This was a limited release of 3500 individually bottles. Bottle number 1516.
Lagavulin 12 - 57.5%
Lagavulin 8 - 48%
Feis 2015 - 59.9%
Please note this lot has a shipping weight for 3 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 30 Year Old - The Ian Hunter Story - Book 1
DESCRIPTION: This is a 30 year old cask strength bottling from the 1987 vintage. This bottle forms the first chapter to the story of Ian Hunter and celebrates the man who introduced the iconic American white Oak barrels to the whisky making at Laphroaig. It is said that it was Ian who made Laphroaig what it is today.

A great chance to purchase the hugely sought after Tamdhu Single cask with the collector's journey 1&2.
Single Cask - European First Fill Sherry Cask #7389. Distilled in 12.12.02 and bottled in April 2018.
Collector Journey 1 - The story behind this series is great. When the casks from Spain were being transported to the UK they passed through Dalbeallie Station. This is one of 1000 bottles.
Collector Journey 2 - The second release from Tamdhu in the series, again limited to 1000 bottles.

Hugely Iconic and recognised all around the world, Ardbeg has not always had things their own way. The distillery was bought by Hiram Walker and DCL in 1959. Their intention was to use this special malt for blending whiskies...
Thankfully this was not the case with Hiram Walker struggling in the late 1980s.
Ever since then the Glenmorangie group have owned the distillery reviving it properly in 1997.
It was hard for the group and revived distillery to produce a core range because of the lack of depth in the cask department...
This is the first age statement at a lovely 17 years old.

The much old Macallan bottled at its cask strength - 58.6%.
Matured in Sherry Oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
The very recognisable Easter Elchie house depicted on the front of the box painted by Sara Middleton.

A special release straight from the sherry oak casks at Easter Elchies house.
Bottled at 60.1% the red label is widely recognised all around the world.
Like sherry? This one is for you!

To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.

A special presentation of Macallan given to Edrington staff members to celebrate the move of the company's headquarters from Perth to Glasgow in April 2017.  100 Queen Street, Glasgow is Macallan's new global headquarters.

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.
This Macallan 18-year-old released in 1992 is very popular amongst both drinkers and collectors.  Once again, the iconic sherry-cask 18-year-old lives up to its reputation.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore - Millennium Release 1263 Custodian Bottling 2018 1st Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the third bottling in the series which was first introduced in 2012 for the fanatics of the distillery or as they like to call it "The 1263 custodians".
Handpicked casks were filled on January 1st 2000 at midnight and released on their big birthdays - 12th, 15th and 18th.
This is the third release in the Millenium series which was bottled in 2018. It was first matured in American oak ex-bourbon casks and then it was nicely finished in Matusalem oloroso sherry butts.

Uigeadail - Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2%, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts. This gives a sweet and smoky finish. It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from. This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.
Ten - Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008. Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
Supernova Stellar - Ardbeg Supernova has been a super popular - the Committee Release sold out in just a few hours back in January 2009. This was the peatiest Ardbeg ever at over 100ppm.
Ardbog - Released in 2013 for Ardbeg Day during Fèis Ìsle, Ardbog is a 10-Year-Old single malt by Ardbeg. It is made from a vatting of whisky matured in a combination of bourbon casks and manzanilla casks, creating a balanced soft, sweet and earthy flavour. In the World Whiskies Awards 2014, Ardbog won Best Islay Whisky NAS.

Ichiro Akuto's Chichibu distillery has been producing exceptional single malts for some time now and their releases have had collectors scrambling to keep up.
This specific bottling was released in 2019 and is one of 1757 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 102.

Taken from European oak Sherry butts specially selected by Iain McArthur, this Fèis Ìle 2014 bottling of Lagavulin was distilled in 1995 and has been said to be one of the best festival releases of the year. This is one of 3,500 individually numbered bottles produced.
This is bottle number 0006.

A limited release from the home of Islay Jazz, Lagavulin. 2004 bottles were released and they were only available to purchase from the distillery.
Bottled at cask strength it displays a great balance between the classic Lagavulin smokiness and a refined tropical fruit flavour.
 
This is bottle number 1515.

A limited release from the home of Islay Jazz, Lagavulin. 2004 bottles were released and they were only available to purchase from the distillery.
Bottled at cask strength it displays a great balance between the classic Lagavulin smokiness and a refined tropical fruit flavour.
 
This is bottle number 1550.

The London Edition (2019) from the Chichibu Distillery in Japan was bottled at 48.5%.  It was an exclusive distillery bottling for the Whisky Show.  
This is one of 1405 individually numbered bottles.

Ichiro Akuto's Chichibu distillery has been producing exceptional single malts for some time now and their releases have had collectors scrambling to keep up.
This specific bottling was released in 2019 and is one of 1757 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 1344.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

Bottled at 100 proof, The Macallan Boutique Collection 2016 bottling was drawn from a selection of matured casks reserved only for distinguished guests visiting Easter Elchers House.
Released exclusively to Travel Retail - this is the first of a two batch release.
A bottling of 1977 vintage Highland Park, released at 21 years old to celebrate the bicentenary of the distillery in 1998. This was is a very collectable bottling which is increasing hard to find.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 1989 16 Year Old - Single Cask #4386
DESCRIPTION: This 16 Year Old single cask Highland Park distilled in 1989 and bottled after 16 years from single cask #4386.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

A bottling of the 12 year old single malt from Macallan, bottled in the 1980s. Very collectable indeed.
The picture on the front is the watercolours by Sara Midleton of one of the most famous landmarks in Speyside - Eater Elchies House.

This stunning bottle is the first part of Highland Park's Valhalla Collection and was released in 2012
Thor is a 16-Year-Old single malt named after the Norse God of Thunder and alleged architect of the Cliffs of Yesnaby on the west coast of Orkney Mainland.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 23,000 bottles of Thor.

This single malt was released by Glenmorangie in 2013 as part of their prestigious  Private Edition range - this was the 4th release in the series. 
Bottled in 2012 and distilled in 1993 the Ealanta was matured fully in virgin American white oak casks. These casks were special due to their heavily charred oak which came from a forest in Missouri. This is how it largely differs from its predecessors as it has been full-term matured opposed to just finished in 'designer' casks.
Awards include:
This has a glass panel on the front.

This Highland Park 25-Year-Old, bottled at 50.7% ABV is estimated to have been bottled in the early 2000s.  
It comes with a striking black, wooden presentation box.

A release that baffled many from the Islay distillery, Bunnahabhain.
This single malt was distilled in 1987 after maturing for 28 years. It came from a single refill bourbon cask #2560.
Different in many ways but great all the same.

This limited edition 1974 vintage Sherry Cask Edition from Balblair Distillery was matured for 27 Years Old and bottled at 46% ABV for The Highland Collection.  This is one of only 550 individually numbered bottles produced. It has a stunning deep bronze colour and is a gem from this highland distillery.
This is bottle number 51.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 22 Year Old - Twenty Something - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
The 2018 edition of the Twenty Something releases, the third bottled exclusively for the Ardbeg Committee, the distillery's fan club.
This 22 year old was distilled in 1996, when the distillery was under the threat of demolition.  It was one of the last distillations in Ardbeg’s old equipment – these stills now sit monumentally outside the distillery gates.  The single malt was matured in ex-bourbon barrels from of some of the most limited stock in any Scottish distillery warehouse.

This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 1988 18 3/5 Year Old - Lunar Bottling
DESCRIPTION:
This 18 year old Highland Park, named The Lunar Bottling as it was inspired by the cycle of the moon (the Lunar Nutation) which takes 18 3/5 years. Distilled in 1988, the single malt was aged for 18 3/5 years, then bottled in 2006 at 45.1% ABV. 
This is one of just 500 bottles.
A bottling of 1977 vintage Highland Park, released at 21 years old to celebrate the bicentenary of the distillery in 1998. This was is a very collectable bottling which is increasing hard to find.

This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
Bottle Number: 495

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Saltire Edition 1 - David Coulthard
DESCRIPTION:
This is a limited, hand-signed, bespoke single cask expression from Highland Park in partnership with Scots Formula 1 star David Coulthard.  It was launched in support of charities in Scotland.
The single cask bottling, Highland Park Saltire Edition is a 13 year old whisky inspired by Coulthard’s 13 Grand Prix victories.  This is one of just 734 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park -18 Year Old Earl Hakkon (Third Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
The third edition of the Highland Park Earls series. The other two bottlings feature Earl Magnus and Saint Magnus.
This 18-year-old has been bottled at cask strength.
Within the beautiful presentation case comes an illustrated leaflet that tells the ancient stories of Haakon. 
3300 bottles were produced.

This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
Released to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival, this is one of only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
This is bottle number 005.

This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
Bottle number: 506

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - The Battle of Jutland
DESCRIPTION: This expression was distilled in 2004, and matured in a refill puncheon cask #3378 for 11 years.  582 bottles were produced to commemorate the largest naval battle of WW1 fought between British and German naval forces with much of the British fleet dispatched from Orkney’s Scapa Flow bay.

Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - The Battle of Jutland
DESCRIPTION: This expression was distilled in 2004, and matured in a refill puncheon cask #3378 for 11 years.  582 bottles were produced to commemorate the largest naval battle of WW1 fought between British and German naval forces with much of the British fleet dispatched from Orkney’s Scapa Flow bay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
This is bottle 390.

Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

The Bowmore maltmen hand selected five casks from the No1 Valuts on the shores of Islay to create this limited edition malt.
The vatting contains cask 1551, 1552, 1553, 1559 and 1560.
Bottled in 2008 after being distilled on the 13th July 1995.
This is bottle number 541 of 3000.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 19 Year Old Old & Rare Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
A beautifully presented single cask expression from an Indy bottler - Hunter Laing. Aged for 19 years in a refill hogshead, this is one of only 60 bottles produced. It was distilled in September 1997 and bottled in April 2017.
As with most of these bottlings from Hunter Laing, it has been non chill filtered. The natural cask strength is a lovely 55% ABV.
This is bottle number 33.

This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
This is bottle number 0070

A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.
Thius exceptional Speyside distillery has produced some great whiskies in its time and this is certainly one of them. At 30 years old this 30 year old is said to be rich and smooth.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 1982 Sherry Wood Cask 15 Year Old #1525​
DESCRIPTION:
An Old Pulteney single cask from the Highlands of Scotland that was distilled in December 1982 and matured for 15 years in a sherry cask #1525.
Don Raitt specially selected this dram in March of 2008, he was the distillery manager.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This is bottle number 279.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak x6
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
This Auchrosik was distilled in 1974 and bottled 28 years later in April 2003 at the natural cask strength of 56.8%. This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.
 
This is bottle number 4897.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 27 Year Old PX G.A.S 1992 #5850 (With Glass)
DESCRIPTION:
Specially selected for the Glendronach appreciation society & Abbeywhisky.com
This 27 year old was matured in a Pedro Ximenez puncheon #5850.
It was distilled on the 27/11/1992 and bottled in 2020. Only 625 bottles were produced. 
Cask Strength - 54.5%
This lot comes with a branded Glass from the Glendronach appreciation society.

Distilled in 1994 and subsequently filled into a single sherry hogshead by the Chancellor of the Exchequer at the time, Mr Kenneth Clarke.
Kenneth worked under John Major until the change in government in 1997.
Filled on the 13th May 1994 and then laid to mature for over 25 years.
It was then bottled, at cask strength, on 13th June 2019.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas. This bottling was distilled in 1995.

This is the 2013 Fèis Ìle bottling from Lagavulin - a triple matured whisky personally selected by Iain McArthur.
One of the most sought after bottles from Fèis Ìle festival, this Lagavulin was Distilled in 1995 then bottled 18 years later in 2013 at natural cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 8 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION:
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the Night’s Watch guard. 
This lot contains 8 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: North Port - 20 Year Old - 1979 Rare Malts
DESCRIPTION:
This series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This single malt is from the closed distillery, North Port, that was demolished in 1983. Distilled in 1979, it was bottled at 20 Years old at the natural cask strength of 61.2%. This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottles.
01144.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Millburn - 25 Year Old - Rare Malts Selection
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
This Highland Malt is a great example of what the series represents.
This Millburn 25-Year-Old single malt was distilled in 1975 and bottled in October 2001, at its natural cask strength of 61.9% ABV. This is an individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 4299.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 26 Year Old 1990 Black Art Edition 6.1
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1990 and bottled at 26 years of age, this is the sixth release in the famous Black Art series.
Only 18,000 of these bottles were produced where the whisky has been distilled, matured and bottled on Islay. 
 
This is bottle number 7464.

This 18 year old Mannochmore is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This malt was matured in refill casks and bottled at the natural cask strength of 66% ABV.  It is one of just 1800 individually numbered bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Daftmill - 2006 Summer Batch Release 2019 75cl US Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife. When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
This bottling represents the very first release that was exclusive to the US market. It is a vatting of seven first fill bourbon barrels which eventually produced 1680 bottles. The barrels were filled on the 30th September 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 20 Year Old -1974 Hart Brothers
DESCRIPTION:
An islay single malt from Caol Ila aged 20 years which was bottled by Hart Brothers.
Distilled in 1974 and in great condition.

This Highland Park 25-Year-Old, bottled at 45.7% ABV is estimated to have been bottled in the early 2000s.  
It comes with a striking, wooden presentation box.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
This is bottle number 226.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
This is bottle number 171.

Only 3350 bottles were released of this very stunning bottle when it was released in 2013. Only 600 were released in the UK and instead of giving the public the details of their inner liquid, once all of the bottle sold out, the information was released in a video in June 2013 by Alan Winchester.
He tells all and gives away the secret that this dram was entirely matured in ex-Scotch whisky casks.

An early bottling from the mid-1990s for Diageo's Rare Malt series - bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.7%, this limited edition 23 year old single malt was distilled in 1973. 
This 1974 vintage Mannochmore was aged for 22 years before being bottled in September 1997.   Bottled at the natural cask strength of 60.1%, this is a limited edition and individually numbered bottle.

This 25 year old Glendronach single malt was distilled on the 12th of February 1993. This bottle was matured in a Pedro Ximenez Puncheon cask - No. 395. It was bottled in 2018 exclusively for The Whisky Shop.
This is bottle number 367.

A cracking expression from Bunnahabhain at 25 years of age.
This is one of the newer releases with this age statement and is just a little bit stronger.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tamdhu - 2003 15 Year Old - Single Cask #2986 Manager's Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the 24th September 2003 and bottled in February 2019, this first-fill limited edition American Oak Oloroso sherry cask. 
This is an individually numbered bottle and is one of only 595 bottles produced from cask #2986.
Selected in 2019 by Sandy McIntyre, this cask plays very much to his personal preferences. 
This is bottle number 304.
A single barrel bottling of 16-year-old Macallan single malt. This is one of only 335 bottles filled by Douglas Laing, from a first fill bourbon cask.
This lot contains 3x 70cl, Gold, Amber, Sienna.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
This is bottle number 198.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 23 Year Old - 1973 Rare Malt
DESCRIPTION:
An early bottling from the mid-1990s for Diageo's Rare Malt series - bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.7%, this limited edition 23 year old single malt was distilled in 1973. 
The Royal Lochnagar distillery is situated close to Balmoral, the Queen’s official residence in Scotland.  Bottled at natural cask strength in April 1997, this limited edition 23 years old whisky was distilled in 1973.
 
This is bottle number 4902.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 16 Year Old Single Cask Series #652 Nato E-3A Component
DESCRIPTION:
One in a large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery Highland Park.
Distilled in 2001 and bottled in 2108, this single cask bottling was matured for 16 years in a 1st fill European Sherry Oak Butt.
There was 626 bottles from cask #652 and selected from Nato E-3A Component.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 20 Year Old  - 1997 Palo Cortado Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This is a limited edition release from Bunnahabhain. Distilled in Nov 1997, matured for 20 years and a then given a finishing period in casks that once held Palo Cortado sherry. Bottled in April 2018 after nearly two years in the Palo Cortado casks at the cask strength of 54.9%. This is one of 1,620 individually numbered bottles produced.
 
This is bottle number 643.

This was the third release from Daftmill, a family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife.  Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.  
This is a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - Roseisle Maltings 25 Year Old 1981
DESCRIPTION:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of Roseisle Maltings, in 2008 Diageo bottled a 25 year old Royal Lochnagar.
It was distilled in 1981 using the very first batch of barley produced.
This is bottle number 243

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Mortlach from Speyside is a beautiful 17 year old distilled in May 1980 and bottled in Feb 98 at a healthy 58.8% ABV.
The Macallan Estate Reserve forms part of The Macallan 1824 Collection and is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.

This was the third release from Daftmill, a family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife.  Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.  
This is a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels.

Aged in a similar style to the Ardbeg 10 year old, apart from the fact that a portion of the whisky was aged in heavily charred barrels. The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name.
The Committee Release of Ardbeg Alligator was exceptional and incredibly popular and so was this Untamed Release...

Aged in a similar style to the Ardbeg 10 year old, apart from the fact that a portion of the whisky was aged in heavily charred barrels. The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name.
The Committee Release of Ardbeg Alligator was exceptional and incredibly popular and so was this Untamed Release...
This 1982 vintage Caol Ila single malt was bottled in 1995 by SMWS at 62.9%.

This bottling is to commemorate Master Distiller Douglas Campbell who worked for Tomatin Distillery for 50 years.
5 casks were taken, 1 from each decade and mixed together to make this special bottle :
An old-style 30-year-old Glenfarclas. Distilled and bottled by J&G Grant, Gelnfarclas Distillery.

This stunning bottle is the third part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection and was released in 2013.
Freya is a 15 year old single malt named after the Norse Goddess associated with fertility, wealth and war.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 19,000 bottles of Freya.

'Loki' is the second part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection.  It was released in 2013. 
Loki is Thor's adoptive brother and known as the trickster - Highland Park have tried to match this 15 year old single malt to his personality.  It comes with a striking display stand and is one of 21,000 bottles produced.

This series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This single malt is from Benrinnes was distilled in 1974. It was bottled at 21 Years Old at the natural cask strength of 60.4%. This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 6319.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label Japan Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker blue label recognised all around the world as being a super-premium blend. 
The walkers family belief is that these small batches and their art of blending is the key success factor behind their unparalleled flavour. 
This bottling was a travel retail exclusive and is given the name "Japan Edition"

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.
This is bottle number 9540.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Finish 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2019, this yearly release from the distillery has been finished in Cabernet Sauvignon casks.
Distilled in 2007 it's said to have a palate resembling caramelised orange, rich napoleon cake and treacle. 
Bottled at cask strength.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label Great Inventions 75cl Taiwan Edition​
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker blue label recognised all around the world as being a super-premium blend. This specific bottling is a higher ABV than the standard and is limited to 3960 bottles.
The walkers family belief is that these small batches and their art of blending is the key success factor behind their unparalleled flavour.

This was a limited release of 11,550 bottles and is a peated malt which was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at the cask strength of 55.5%.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building CHchibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

597 bottles were released on the 2nd March 2019 in the World Duty Free store at Edinburgh Airport.
Distilled in November 2002 and bottled in February 2019, this first-fill Oloroso sherry cask from Jerez, was hand-picked by key members of the Dufry and Edinburgh Airport teams in November 2018 during a visit to the Tamdhu Distillery. Officially the oldest ever single cask released from Tamdhu.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Glasgow Garden Festival 1988 (75cl)
DESCRIPTION: A rare ceramic Bowmore released for Glasgow Garden Festival in 1988, with Bowmore 15-year-old inside, which has hints of white chocolate, exotic fruits and pepper.

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this bottle is from an unknown early batch as they were un-numbered at the beginning of this series.  This bottle is thought to be from between batch 1- batch 5. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

Craigellachie goes hand in hand with Speyside. Formerly owned by White Horse (now Diageo) distillers this distillery is now producing its own single malt. 
We owe a lot to this distillery for its contribution to so many blends over the past decades and now it is time to celebrate it as its own single malt.

Bottled in 2019, this is one of 688 bottles. This Speyside malt comes from a Sherry butt finish after being matured for 20 years.
French indie bottler La Maison du Whisky is to thank for this wonderful expression.

This lot includes 5 bottles as per the below -
Chateau les Eyquem - 2013 Grand Vin de Bordeaux 75cl 12.5%
Réserve de L'estey - Médoc 2014 Calvet 75cl 12.5%
Grignan les Adhémar - Cuvée Traditionalle 2014 13% 75cl
Ch Rousseau - Bordeaux 2015 13% 75cl
Châtaeu Saint-Germain - 2014 Bordeaux Supérieur 13% 75cl
La Fleaur Baron - Bordeaux - Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon 2014 12.5% 75cl
A long discontinued bottle from the Orkney distillery. We estimate this bottle to be from the late 1980s.

Featuring exclusive artwork by Koralie by La Maison Du Whisky this Bowmore was distilled in 2001 and forms part of the Artist Collection.
15 Years were spent in a single hogshead number 20115 to form this expression. Only 286 bottles have been produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach -  20 Year Old #10299 120th Anniversary 1998 Single Marsala Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2018 to celebrate the 120th anniversary of the distillery this is a very special Ben Riach indeed. The dram was matured in a Marsala hogshead and only yielded 290 bottles.
This is bottle number 133 of 290.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: William Grant - 25 Year Old - Rare & Extraordinary (75cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This 25-year-old blended Malt was created by William Grant & Sons Master Blender David Stewart. It was made using whisky from across Scotland and was specially selected to celebrate achieving three Queens Awards for Export Achievement: 1974, 1989 and 1996, along with winning Distiller of the Year in 1999 and 2000 - no distiller had ever won this award twice. 
It comes is a black presentation box and was bottled at 43%.  This is a 75cl bottling.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

A beautiful sherry cask from Glendronach aged 12 years.
This bottle is dated in the 1980s.
Very rare and becoming a great bottle for collectors.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony Master's Select Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The new kid on the block for Hibiki, blending ten plus single malts and grains. These include Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita.
5 types of casks were used and typical Hibiki fashion the bottle always has 24 facets which represent 24 seasons in the Japanese lunar calendar.
Shinji Fukuyo, the fourth-gen blender has his name to this bottle. However, it wasn't without careful guidance from the third generation master blender.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 19 Year Old 1995 AD Rattray Cask Collection
DESCRIPTION:
A.D. Rattray company managed by Stanley Walker Morrison. He was the grandson of the Stanley P. Morrison who owned another distillery on the island, Bowmore.
A 19 year old single malt from the Speyside region. It was matured on the banks of the River Spey in a bourbon hogshead. Only 310 bottles were produced after being bottled 01.09.2015.

Bottled to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the distillery, this came to market in July 2014.
This is a vatting of all 5 decades the distillery had in their warehouses and is one of 5230 bottles.
This is bottle number 988.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
Apple pie with vanilla ice cream, this Island malt was distilled in 1995 and bottled in October of 2004.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

A special bottling only for the Scandinavian market.
Its a 12 year old Highland Park which only released 3,924 bottles.

Highland Park Capella was released in 2002. It marks the 60th anniversary of one of the most famous landmarks on the island  - The Italian Chapel.
This is 1 of only 5,400 produced from the Northernmost Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - 1996 Ambassador Cask #2
DESCRIPTION: This is the second Ambassadors Cask release from Highland Park. This 1996 vintage single malt was aged for 10 years in a refill sherry oak cask and bottled at cask strength in 2006. A very collectable release.

Bottled in 2017, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 2000 it's said to have a palate resembling Morello cherries, blueberry pie, cinnamon and soft chewy liquorice.
Bottled at cask strength.

This single cask Dalmore was distilled in 1995 and released exclusively for Dalmore distillery in 2012 at their highland home.
This expression was matured in a bourbon cask before being finished in a Matusalem Olosoro sherry cask.
Cask #200 yielded only 650 bottles from which this is one.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park -15 Year Old Earl Hakkon (Edition 1)
DESCRIPTION:
The first edition of the Highland Park Earls series. The other two bottlings feature HaakonMagnus and Saint Magnus.
This 15-year-old has been bottled at cask strength.
Within the beautiful presentation case comes an illustrated leaflet that tells the ancient stories of Haakon. 
5976 bottles were produced.

Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

A beautiful sherry cask from Glendronach aged 12 years.
This bottle is dated in the 1980s.
Very rare and becoming a great bottle for collectors.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 02/07/28 this is one of only 470 bottles produced.

This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

Distilled in 1995 for The Whisky Shop, this exclusive bottling was chosen by the distillery manager at the time, Ian Mackay.
It was matured in 65% Mathusalem sherry casks and 35% American ex-bourbon casks.

The Glenfiddich range has a new member, Grand Cru.
'The ultimate spirit of celebration' was released on general sale at the distillery in 2019 and has been matured for 23 years in American and European oak casks.
The finishing touch is the expression being finished in French cuvée casks.

The Glenfiddich range has a new member, Grand Cru.
'The ultimate spirit of celebration' was released on general sale at the distillery in 2019 and has been matured for 23 years in American and European oak casks.
The finishing touch is the expression being finished in French cuvée casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2003 Single Cask  #5878 Braunstein & Friends
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was limited to 648 bottles and aged for 12 years in a single cask.
Highland Park bottled cask #5878 especially for Braunstein & Friends in 2016.
It was a 1st fill European sherry butt and was distilled back in 2003.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.
