This limited edition Macallan was created in partnership with The Whisky Shop.  It was originally released as part of the 1700 series for the Travel Retail market.  It was discontinued in 2012 and has become a sought after bottling.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cutty Sark - Tam O'Shanter 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate one of the nations and possibly worlds most famous poets days...Burns night!
2012 saw this blend names after Rabbies most famous poems, Tam O'Shanter. The box depicts the nature of the poem and within the box there is a great book that has the poem in full. There is also some history regarding the poem and a small selection of images of art that the story was inspired from. 
Kirsteen Campbell selected this bottling (Cutty Sark master blender) and only 5000 were produced.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

This  Bunnahabhain expression was released exclusively for the Coterie Club members. It was distilled in 2004 and matured for 15 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks  for 6 years.  This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.
This special version was gifted exclusively to Edrington & Maxxium Staff on the occasion of the new distillery opening on 2nd June 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Deveron - 30 Year Old - Royal Burgh Collection
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 30-year-old single malt from Macduff distillery, under the name Glen Deveron. This bottling was originally released for the Travel Retail market as part of the Glen Deveron Royal Burgh Collection.  The collection commemorates the Royal Burgh of Banff, the ancient seaport beside the distillery that was granted a Royal Charter by Robert II, King of Scotland, ‘Robert the Bruce’. This Charter is represented by the seal which appears on the label of every bottle.
This series also included 16 year old and a 20 year old expressions.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Ryder Cup 2014
DESCRIPTION:
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ryder Cup Edition which took place in Gleneagles 2014 where Europe thrashed America by 16½ points to 11½, for their third consecutive victory.
Diageo used to own the hotel in Gleneagles and have a bar there dedicated to Johnnie Walker. This hotel has since been taken over.
 
This is bottle number 1397.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets, this whisky was named Best Single Malt of the Year at the World Whisky Awards 2009. Released in October 2007, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

Bottled in 2017, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 2000 it's said to have a palate resembling Morello cherries, blueberry pie, cinnamon and soft chewy liquorice.
Bottled at cask strength.

Bottled in 2018, this yearly release from the distillery has been finished in Pedro Ximenez casks. 
Distilled in 1999 it's said to have a palate resembling Columbian coffee, roasted hazelnuts and pecan pie.
Bottled at cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 23 Year Old Cask Strength 2017 Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of only 5514 bottles from the Highland distillery. This specific bottling was distilled in 1993 and when released by Diageo it was included in the 2017 special release.
Aged for 23 years this bottle was released at cask strength. 
 
This is bottle number 3941 of 5514.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV. The 2019 bottling is at 52.9% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

A single cask edition from Strathisla aged for 26 years in a sherry butt. It was distilled on the 22nd of June in 1989 and bottled on the 30th of July in 2015. 
There were 516 bottles produced at a cask strength of 57.6%.
The distillery reserve collection is a limited release of rare and exceptional whiskies from Chivas brothers.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.
This 18-year-old Highland Park is an old presentation from the early 2000s. The dumpy style bottle was used from 1999 until Highland Park was redesigned in the mid-2000s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 20 Year Old Cask Strength SC 20 007
DESCRIPTION:
From the Chivas Brothers this Scapa 20-year-old was bottled at cask strength in 2013. 
It was distilled in 1993 and presented in their older style packing it is simply lovely. The batch number reads SC 20 007.
It is said to have round flavours of peaches and candy. What's not to love about that?

Writers Tears Copper Pot Blend is vatting of aged single pot still and single malt whiskeys from an unnamed Cork distillery. This bottling is produced from a vatting of single pot still and single malt whiskeys. Triple distilled and aged in American oak casks.  This is one of 1980 bottles, released at the cask strength of 53%.

This Mortlach 16 year old single malt is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson. This bottling has been discontinued and is no longer available from Diageo's Flora and Fauna series.  It is becoming increasingly hard to find.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

This is the third release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series. 
Created to show the complexity and depth that can be achieved through aging, Rare Cask comes from a broad selection of casks, including American oak sherry casks and European oak casks – a large number of which are first-fill.
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2004 Moine Port Pipe Finish - Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This 2004 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain was limited to just 1596 bottles, released for the Feis Ile 2017.
Distilled in December 2004 it was matured in refill hogshead casks, then finished in Moine Port Pipes.  It was bottled in March 2017 at 55.6%. 
 
Bottle number 5.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: J.J. Corry - Anfa Irish Whiskey & Drinks By The Dram 50% (BOTTLE 1)
DESCRIPTION:
This is bottle no1 of 66 of the Chapel Gate whiskey bonders.
They did this expression with Drinks by the Dram to create Anfa.
Each bottling is a limited edition release and are made with a selection of single malts and married with grain whiskey.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenturret - 1987 29 Year Old - Jamieson's Jigger Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This is a single cask official bottling of Glenturret, of which there are not many. This edition was dedicated to retired cooper Michael Jamieson, who worked in the industry for 44 years. Distilled in 1987, matured in cask #553 and bottled 29 years later. The Glenturret Jamieson’s Jigger Edition is limited to 170 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 136.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton Of Glen Ord - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram 2016
DESCRIPTION: A 16-year-old Single malt from Glen Ord, specially selected by malt distillery managers within Diageo Distillery Ltd and bottled at natural cask strength. This is the 2016 Edition.

The Keystones Series 4th release, from Highland Park, Yesnaby.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the cliff on the coast of the Islands. Atlantic side.
Cask Info
- First-fill Sherry seasoned American Oak casks.
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - 1999 Whisky Live
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition 10-year-old Highland Park bottled to commemorate 10 years of Whisky Live.  It was distilled in 1999, matured in sherry Oak casks, bottled in 2009 at the cask strength of 59.3%.  This is a limited edition of only 600 bottles.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Black Friday - 21 Year Old - Whisky Exchange III 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The third release from The Whisky Exchange and their Black Friday bottling. It sold out in 11 minutes because it an outstanding dram. It was bottled at cask strength...
Last year’s release was a Highland Park (unofficial) and this year an older undisclosed Speyside 21 Year Old year old was chosen.
They did disclose that the distillery was founded as early as 1810, located between Forres and Elgin and rarely seen as a single malt whisky.
Glen Burgie?????

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 23 Year Old Single Cask Edition #1069
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask series comes from the Chivas Brothers, was bottled on the 28th of July in 2015. Matured in cask 1069 for 23 years this cask produced 780 bottles.
All of the Chivas distillery single cask editions were made available from their respective distillery shop. This, of course, is quite rare a rare bottling and made even more so for this fact. Grab it now while you can.  
This is bottle number 751 of 780.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

A limited-edition 1979 vintage from Balblair Distillery was matured for 24 years in a bourbon cask.  It was bottled in October 2003 at 46%. This is an individually numbered bottle and is one of only 3150 produced.
This is bottle number 0773.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - The Dark
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2017, 'The Dark' is first in the Highland Park series that celebrates the seasons on the Isle of Orkney, where Highland Park is made. The Dark is a 17-year-old single malt that has been matured in sherry casks, giving it aromas of dried fruits, nuts and herbs combined with smoky peat to as a nod to the autumn and winter seasons of Orkney.  The Light followed in 2018 symbolising spring and summer. 
The Dark is a limited release 28,000.

To make The Dalmore King Alexander III, Master Distiller Richard Paterson specially selected 6 casks of differently aged Dalmore malts matured in wine, Madeira, sherry, marsala, Kentucky bourbon and port casks.  A remarkable feat of blending crafted to honour the act of saving Scotland's King in 1263.  It is a rich, fruity Highland single malt.

Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Single Cask #2865 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 18 years in an American Oak Butt.
606 bottles were produced from this cask.
This SMWS is called the mediavel combat dram which is a 19-year-old Dalmore, matured in a refill sherry butt and bottled at 59.2%. This is one of only 576  bottles.
"Pass the flapjacks!" - this single cask by Scotch Malt Whisky Society is a 18-year-old Bladnoch. This is one of just 271 bottles produced. This was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.6%.

This is a 2017 Fèis Ìle Festival bottling from Bowmore Distillery. It has been matured for 11 years in Oloroso sherry and Bordeaux wine casks. It was bottled at cask strength.  This is a limited release of only 2000 bottles.   
This is bottle number 0949.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Single Cask #2865 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 18 years in an American Oak Butt.
606 bottles were produced from this cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Virgin Oak #1590
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery.  It was distilled in March 2009 and matured in virgin oak cask #1558 until December 2019 when it was bottled at 56.8% abv. 
This is bottle number 89.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - St. Magnus
DESCRIPTION:
The second in one of the most popular series Highland Park have released, the Orkenyinga Saga trilogy consisting of; Earl Magnus, Saint Magnus and Earl Haakon.  St Magnus was murdered by his cousin Earl Haakon, who himself was honoured with a Highland Park bottling. 
This 12-Year-Old single mlat was distilled in 1999 and was ottled at cask the strength of 55%. This is one of 11,994 bottles of Saint Magnus.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - St. Magnus Festival 2006
DESCRIPTION: This 12-Year-Old single malt was distilled in 1999 and was bottled at 40% for the St Magnus Festival in 2006. This is one of 500 bottles of Saint Magnus. This limited edition release was bottled on the 30th anniversary of the festival, and that year they celebrated Orkney's poet and raconteur George Mackay Brown.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
Bottle number 1368.

Distilled in December 2007, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 10 years -  fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks.
This was a limited release of just 1881 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.

Distilled and bottled from barley grown on the Kintyre Peninsula within just a few miles of Springbank distillery itself.
This barely is still malted on their own malt floors using traditional techniques. Bottling takes place on-site making it 100% Campbellton single malt.
Distilled July 2009.
Bottled in October 2019.
9000 Bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ichiro's - Malt and Grain World Blend Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Ichiro’s Malt & Grain World Blended Whisky from Chichibu Distillery. This is a limited edition bottling created by Ichiro Akuto, the Japanese whisky extraordinaire and Chichibu Distillery founder.
Non chill filtered and non coloured.
Imported to the UK by speciality drinks.

Glengoyne  21 Year Old  Won a Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.  This Highland single malt was matured in hand-selected quality first fill European oak sherry casks for 21 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Single Cask #2865 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 18 years in an American Oak Butt.
606 bottles were produced from this cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3374 - Loch Fyne Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Loch Fyne Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3374 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 584 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Viking Collection - 1997 The Sword
DESCRIPTION: This is a rare 1997 vintage release of Highland Park single malt that was released as part of the Viking Collection. It was originally bottled for Taiwan and the distillery shop.

'Hillhead' bottled at 46% ABV, marries both flavour and strength and was matured in three casks: European Oak Sherry, American Oak Sherry and American Oak Bourbon.  Hillhead was the last in a series of five special editions, showcasing Highland Park's five keystones of production.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 16 Year Old Hand Filled Sherry Cask Batch #A16
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in sherry casks for 16 years is this distillery exclusive.
It has been hand bottled on 29th April 2017.
Batch A16.
This is bottle number 1084.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.

This expression was discontinued and it was most certainly brilliant. The aged 15-year-old Highland Park is sought after by collectors all over the world. 
Presented in the unique older style bottle that was used from 1999 until it was redesigned in the mid-2000s.

First-fill sherry-seasoned Spanish oak butts, first-fill sherry seasoned American oak casks and first-fill bourbon barrels and hogsheads were hand-selected and combined with a small number of refill casks to provide a degree of softness to the whisky’s final flavour.
Three legendary Highland Park Whisky Makers – Gordon Motion, Max McFarlane and John Ramsay – produced this expression to explore the influence of wood and cask seasoning on the flavour and character of our whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Virgin Oak #1590
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery.  It was distilled in March 2009 and matured in virgin oak cask #1558 until December 2019 when it was bottled at 56.8% abv. 
This is bottle 209

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - Grooves (NHS HIGHLANDS & ISLANDS CHARITY BOTTLE)
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.
All proceeds from this bottle, including the buyers commission, will go to the Highlands & Islands NHS in aid and support of the fight against the COVID19 virus.
Stay well and safe, 
TGWA TEAM

The Octomore 08.1 edition is: 167 ppm and was distilled in 2008 using 100% Scottish barley, from 2007 harvest. 100% matured in first fill American oak casks, including Buffalo Trace, Clermont Springs, Four Roses, Heaven Hill & Jack Daniels.
This is the first release in Octomore's four-strong Masterclass series.

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 18 Year Old #3610 1996 Single Cask Pedro Ximenez Finish
DESCRIPTION:
One of the favourites distilleries here at The Grand Whisky Auction, this Benriach was aged for 18 years. Its final years were spent in a Pedro Ximenez sherry puncheon. 
 As always Benriach are releasing a fantastic range of whiskies and vintages.
This 1996 vintage was exclusive to the UK market and only 668 bottles were produced. Billy Walker signed off on this dram...so we know the calibre we are amongst here. 
This is bottle number 81.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is exceptional with both expressions adding up to 65 years of maturation. Presented in a stunning case with the gold logo on the front. 
25 Year Old - 43% ABV, 70cl.
40 Year Old - 46% ABV, 5cl.

Gordon & Macphail is a family-owned company and is the custodian of some of the rarest single malt whiskies in the world.
This Glenglassaugh was distilled in 1983 and selected to be bottled by Gordon & MacPhail in 1993. 
A pick from the highland region is their great connoisseur choice range.

Hobbister is the first release in the Highland Park Keystone Series – a collection of special bottlings that highlight our five Keystones of production which combine to make Highland Park stand apart from other Single Malts.
The special edition takes its name from a peat moor.  This environment creates a unique aromatic peat consisting of decaying heather and plants rather than the trees that characterise the peat used by other distilleries.
A release of 1,200 bottles.

Highland Park Ingvar is a cask strength special edition that is part of Highland Park's Viking Warrior Series.  It was released exclusively for Taiwan Duty-Free.
Ingvar Ragnarsson was a warrior king known for his exceptional cruelty, strength and skill with many weapons.

The special edition takes its name from a peat moor.  This environment creates a unique aromatic peat consisting of decaying heather and plants rather than the trees that characterise the peat used by other distilleries.
A release of 1,200 bottles.

The Keystones Series 2nd release, from Highland Park, Shiel.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The shovels, made of wood, that are used to turn the barley is where the name Shiel originates.
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Quercus - Keystone Series 3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 3rd release, from Highland Park, Quercus.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the kind of Oak used to make their casks. They are sent to Spain (Jerez) in order to in sherry before returning to the distillery. 
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - 40 Years of Orkney Rugby Club
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2006, this single malt from Orkney was specially bottled to celebrate 40 years of Orkney Rugby Club.
Distilled in Kirkwall, Highland Park is the most Northerly Scottish Single Malt Distillery in the World.
Highland Park 16-Year-Old, a now-discontinued litre bottling, previously destined for the travel retail market.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 10 Year Old (2006) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 10 year old Royal Lochnagar is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This single malt has been matured in European Oak casks. It was bottled and released in 2006, at the natural cask strength of 57.2%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: J.J. Corry - Anfa Irish Whiskey & Drinks By The Dram 50%
DESCRIPTION:
Chapel Gate whiskey bonder with Drinks by the Dram created this expression 'Anfa'.
Each bottling is a limited edition release and are made with a selection of single malts and married with grain whiskey.
This is one of only 66 individually numbered bottles. 
This is bottle number 9.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

Only 155 bottles of this single grain scotch whisky have been produced from the Highland distillery, Invergordon.
Distilled in May 1997 this cask strength expression was aged for 22 years before being bottled by the family-owned firm Douglas Laing. 
Presented in a lovely wooden case.

Once known for being the smallest distillery in Scotland, it is now owned by Signatory. Bottled on the 29.05.2019 this is one of only 685 bottles. 
Presented in this beautiful decanter this Highland malt is not be missed by collectors all around the world.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 2003 14 Year Old -  Micro Provenance Bourbon/ Calvados
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich unique Micro-Provenance series is as a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This 14 year old is a limited edition of just 438 individual bottles.  It was matured in a bourbon / Calvados cask that was filled in 14/12/2003 and then bottled on 18/12/2018.
Cask No: 10/179-1

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 06/12/2018 this is one of only 612 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 2003 14 Year Old -  Micro Provenance Bourbon/ Calvados
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich unique Micro-Provenance series is as a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This 14 year old is a limited edition of just 438 individual bottles.  It was matured in a bourbon / Calvados cask that was filled in 14/12/2003 and then bottled on 18/12/2018.
Cask No: 10/179-1

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmunach - 2014 Reserve Collection 4 Year Old 50cl / Single Cask Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the 22nd October 2014 and matured in 1st fill barrel #1301909 for 4 years, this single cask is part of the Distillery reserve collection. 
This, 2014, is the first vintage from Dalmunach. It is now a Chivas Brothers distillery and is on the site of the old Imperial Distillery. 
It is one of only 348 bottles.
This is bottle number 251.

This is the second instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver series. 
This single malt whisky was drawn from a combination of bourbon barrels and second-fill ex-Oloroso Sherry. Released in May 2017 at 50% ABV. This is one of 1450 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old 2001 Single Cask #386 Vintersolstandet
DESCRIPTION:
Only 594 bottles were produced from this vintage cask which is from Highland Parks single cask series. 
Distilled in 2001 and matured for 16 years before being bottled from cask #386, which was a European SHerry Oak Butt.
Vintersolståndet - "The Swedish winter solstice"

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Wolfburn - Ansuz The Kylver Series (4th Release)
DESCRIPTION: Wolfburns 4th release of the Kylver series.   Each bottle has a letter from the runic alpabet, which was on the Kylver stones. This peated bottling has the symbol “Ansuz”, which translates as “god” or “gods”. The whisky was matured for around four years in a combination of first-fill bourbon barrels and second-fill quarter casks.

Hobbister is the first release in the Highland Park Keystone Series – a collection of special bottlings that highlight our five Keystones of production which combine to make Highland Park stand apart from other Single Malts.
The special edition takes its name from a peat moor.  This environment creates a unique aromatic peat consisting of decaying heather and plants rather than the trees that characterise the peat used by other distilleries.
A release of 1,200 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 9 Year Old - Local Barley July 2009
DESCRIPTION: All of the barley used to make this 9 year old has been sourced within the local area of  Kintyre, Scotland (as the name may suggest).  A much sought-after bottle by collectors and investors.

Specially selected and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail, this Highland malt was distilled at Clynelish distillery in 1997. It was bottled in 2010 exclusively for Brora Golf Club coming from cask number #10231.
Brora golf course was established in 1891 and in 1923 James Braid visited the course only to go and redesign the layout. 
Rarely seen at auction, don't miss this opportunity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - 40 Years of Orkney Rugby Club
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2006, this single malt from Orkney was specially bottled to celebrate 40 years of Orkney Rugby Club.
Distilled in Kirkwall, Highland Park is the most Northerly Scottish Single Malt Distillery in the World.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

Ardbeg always has an annual Feis Ile bottling and this little beauty was released on 1st June 2012.
12,000 were produced and married in ex refill sherry casks.
Available at the distillery and online to committee members.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

Distilled and mature don the beautiful Island of Orkney, this Scapa single malt was matured for 18 years. 5 Different casks were used - 194, 211,212,214 & 217.
It was bottled on the 26th of July 2018 and only 1512 bottles were made available. 
The Chivas collection made their bottles available at the respective distillery shops.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 19 Year Old - Age of Discovery - Madeira Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION: This is the third release in the Glenfiddich's Travel Retail Age of Discovery series. This is a 19-year-old single malt Scotch whisky has been matured in oak casks that originally held Madeira. Produced in honour of the Portuguese explorers of the 15th century.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalmore 2009 - Ian MacLeod Connoisseur Society Cask - #171
DESCRIPTION: A rare and very interesting single cask Dalmore bottling.  This 2009 vintage was bottled by Ian MacLeod in 2018 exclusively for whiskyclub.co's Connoisseur Society.  This is one of 319 bottles drawn from single cask #171 at the natural cask strength of 59.1%.

A very nicely presented single malt expression of Knockando 21 year old.
It was distilled 1989 and is presented alongside two glasses.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dallas Dhu - 10 Year Old - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: This Speyside Dallas Dhu 10 Year Old was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.

Matured in a fresh Olorosso cask, this 2004 Hazelburn was bottled after 14 years in Feb 2019. Often mistaken for being its own distillery, Hazelburn is the third bottling which is produced down in Campbeltown at Springbank. 
There is no Peat influence unlike its sister production (Longrow). 
This is one of 9900 bottles.

Glen Ord distillery is just outside of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years. 
This now-discontinued bottling was matured in Sherry oak casks for 12 years.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

A 12 year old blended malt from Morrison & MacKay's Old Perth range.  This is one of 666 bottles produced.  This blend is a combination of malt whisky from Macallan and Highland Park, drawn from a single cask.

The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.

A rare Glenlossie 12 Year Old bottled November 2004 at 55.5% volume.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.

The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: SMWS -31.18 - Isle of Jura - 20 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This single cask by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society is a 20-year-old Isle of Jura. This is one of just 259 bottles produced. Matured in a refill hogshead / ex-bourbon casks and bottled at the natural cask strength of 56.2%. The bottle is said to be a 'Manly, masculine dram'.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

GlenDronach's 15 Year Old Revival was sadly discontinued in 2015 by the distillery due to lack of available stocks.  However, stocks have been replenished and The GlenDronach 15 Year Old Revival has returned. This bottling was matured in Oloroso sherry casks.

Lagavulin Offerman Edition is an 11-Year-Old, limited edition released as a tribute to Nick Offerman. Nick Offerman was known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

Distilled and mature don the beautiful Island of Orkney, this Scapa single malt was matured for 18 years. 5 Different casks were used - 194, 211,212,214 & 217.
It was bottled on the 26th of July 2018 and only 1512 bottles were made available. 
The Chivas collection made their bottles available at the respective distillery shops.
Grey Goose brings together vodka and Cognac in their VX, which stands for "vodka exceptionnelle". It's made using their high-quality French vodka and a hint of Cognac
This is a 1L bottling of a long discontinued 12 Year Old from the Scapa Distillery in Orkney.  It was matured for 12 years in clifftop warehouses overlooking the beautiful waters of the Scapa Flow.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #974 (35cl)
DESCRIPTION: This 35cl single cask bottling of Highland Park selected and bottled exclusively for Maxxium Netherlands from Cask #974.  It was bottled at 12 years old and at cask strength.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

Distilled in the Highlands of Scotland, this Balblair was hand-bottled/filled on the 23rd/5/12.
It was distilled in 1992 and put into cask number 2990.
Matured in a bourbon cask, it was also bottled at cask strength - 60.9%
Bottle number 112

This bottle is one of no more than 800 bottles drawn from the single cask number 15650. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt for at least 15 years before being selected by David Stewart, the Balvenie Malt Master. 
This is bottle number 656.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - 10 Year old 2008 Artist Collective LMDW
DESCRIPTION:
This special bottling was designed by artist Serge Le Fox and was distilled back in 2008. It was matured for 10 years in 9 refill bourbon barrels.
Clynelish has seen a resurgence in the last few years with the announcement of the reopening of Brora distillery on the horizon.
Comes with 2 branded glasses.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - Collectors Edition
DESCRIPTION: This is a Collector's Edition decanter of Johnnie Walker Black Label. Johnnie Walker Black Label is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

Glendronach 2003 bottled for The Green Welly Stop.
A Single Cask at 13 Year Old was fully matured in PX Sherry cask - Number 713 .
Bottled in September 2016 and distilled on 1st August 2003.
670 of these bottles were produced.
This is bottle number 229.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old 2003 Single Cask #1935 Calle Cask No.1
DESCRIPTION:
One from the Single Cask series brought to you by Highland Park, comes this 13 year old single malt.
It was distilled in 2003 and bottled for Calle Cask No.1 in 2016.
It is one of 654 Bottles and had been matured in refill butt #1935.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - 17 Year Old -1996 Private Cask - TWE
DESCRIPTION: This is one of only 245 bottles selected and bottled for The Whisky Exchange from sherry hogshead 1996/2033. This 1996 vintage was bottled in June 2014 for the Arran Private Cask Collection.

This was the Kilchoman Fèis Ìle 2015, which was sold exclusively at Kilchoman Distillery.  Matured in bourbon casks numbers 245, 249 & 250 distilled May 2008, it was bottled in May 2015 at 58.2% ABV.  This is one of only 742 bottles produced.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2014 and includes double matured Laphroaig from bourbon barrels and Amontillado seasoned traditional hogsheads.  It was bottled at 51.4% ABV.

This limited edition of just 3000 bottles was released in 2015 by Kilchoman Distillery to celebrate their 10th anniversary of opening.  This special bottling is made up of both Sherry and bourbon Kilchoman cask matured whiskies with vintages varying from 2005 to 2012. Excitingly, whisky from the first cask ever filled (01/2005) is used for this celebratory release.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  Today, it is the biggest selling single malt from Islay, and one of the last distilleries using its own floor maltings.
A limited edition that was released during Laphroaig open day at the Feis Ile 2015, to celebrate 200 years of Laphroaig.
For this special edition, Cairdeas Master Distiller John Campbell used 100% floor malted barley (from the distillery’s own small malting floor) and used only the two smaller, older stills during distillation. It was also fully matured in Warehouse No.1, right by the sea on Islay.
Laphroaig truly wanted to ensure this was a special release for their 200th Anniversary and is John’s interpretation of how Laphroaig would have been produced 200 years ago.  It was matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years.

This release of Morrison & MacKay's Old Perth blended malt is named in honour of  Perth, Scotland and its historical connection to whisky.  This vintage 1996 blended malt features Macallan & Highland Park malt whiskies that were matured in a single sherry cask.

This vintage is from 1995 and it was matured exclusively in American Oak. Prior to this Glenrothes was such an integral part of blended Scotch Whisky. It featured in Cutty Sark and Famous Grouse. 
This was bottled in 2016 and is a limited edition.

Old Pulteney 17 Year Old got a very high score in the whisky bible - 96.5! All this in the same year as receiving an award for the best whisky in the world.
This specific bottling has since been discontinued... you know what that means.

Released as part of the Glenlivet Nadurra range, this single malt was fully matured in first-fill American Oak casks.  Every release in this series was bottled and released in small batches - this is batch #0114A was bottled in 01/14. This is a 70cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jura - 22 Year Old - One for the Road
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition bottling for Jura to celebrate the distillery managers 39 year contribution. Willie Cochrane's bottling is a 22 year old single malt finished in Pinot Noir casks.  This is one of only 672 bottles produced.

Lagavulin Offerman Edition is an 11-Year-Old, limited edition released as a tribute to Nick Offerman. Nick Offerman was known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

No Name No. 2 is a limited edition blend by Compass Box, described as being ‘more refined’ than the original No Name released in 2017.  This expression is largely made up of refill Sherry butt-matured Caol Ila, and Talisker aged in re-charred American oak hogsheads, as well as older malt Clynelish, matured in hogsheads.

This Glenglassaugh 1986 was specially selected and bottled in 2006 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.  1986 was the year that Glenglassaugh distillery was closed before it was again reopened in 2005.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2132 - The W Club
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The W Club.  Distilled in 2006, this single malt was matured for 11 years in first fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon #2132 and was bottled at the cask strength of 67% ABV.  With only 615 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

Bottled for La Maison du Whisky in 2019, this dram was distilled in 2004. There was 726 bottles produced of this expression.
As we all know Old Pulteney used to be the most Northern distillery on mainland UK however, this title has now been given to Wolfburn.
This is bottle number 109.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Irishman - 2000 Single Cask 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
A Single Malt Irish whiskey that has been triple distilled and bottled by Walsh Whiskey Distillery Ltd.
However, the experts among us will know this dram was probably distilled at New Midleton. 
This bottle is one of 600 bottles and was matured in single sherry cask #6938.
Bottle number 317 of 600.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

Distilled in 2004, this Glendullan was bottled by Gordon and MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice range. 
This was matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels before being bottled in 2006 at 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Masters of Photography - Rankin - Book
DESCRIPTION: This book is a photographic essay of The Macallan Estate, by famous photographer, Rankin.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 20 Year Old Distillery Reserve Collection #9057
DESCRIPTION:
This Aberlour 20 Year Old single malt was released as part of the Distillery Reserve Collection. These single cask bottlings were exclusively available at Chivas Brothers distilleries.
Aged for 20 years in cask Number 9057 this first fill sherry was eventually bottled on the 19th of July 2018. Bottled at cask strength. 
Only 1056 bottles were produced from this cask.
This is bottle number 59.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 1995 G&M Cask No #1502 La Maison Du Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
From the Orcadian distillery Highland Park, this is an independent bottling from one of the largest in the business - Gordon & Macphail.
Distilled in 1995 it was matured in cask 1502 and then bottled in 2017 at cask strength for La Maison du Whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 2007 Cask Strength - Distillery Only
DESCRIPTION:
This cask strength Caol Ila, was released only at the distillery shop in 2017.
3000 bottles were made available and bottled at their natural cask strength.

This 16 year old Scapa is part of the Distillery Reserve Collection from Chivas Brothers' single malt whisky.  This was distilled on 6th Feb 2002 and bottled from the casks above.  It was bottled at cask strength at 50.9%% abv.  
This is one of 1644 bottles produced. This is a 50cl bottling.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2019 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 52.9% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

Lagavulin Offerman Edition is an 11-Year-Old, limited edition released as a tribute to Nick Offerman. Nick Offerman was known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

This 16 year old Scapa is part of the Distillery Reserve Collection from Chivas Brothers' single malt whisky.  This was distilled on 6th Feb 2002 and bottled from the casks above.  It was bottled at cask strength at 50.9%% abv.  
This is one of 1644 bottles produced. This is a 50cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

This 1993 vintage Clynelish single malt double matured in Oloroso Seco cask wood casks. Bottled in 2010 at 46% by Diageo for their Distillers Edition series.  This is an early bottling in the series, a very collectable bottling.
This is batch number Cl-Br:173-5J

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilchoman - 2012 Single Cask - Berry Bros & Rudd
DESCRIPTION: This is one of just 326 bottles from a single sherry hogshead #553/2012. Distilled in 2012, it was bottled in 2019 by Kilchoman Distillery exclusively for Berry Bros & Rudd.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Single Cask Series Arne 2004 #6493 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
One in a large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery Highland Park. Matured in a refill Sherry Butt (#6493) for 13 years and bottled in 2004 for Total Wine. 
There were only 554 bottles taken from this cask.
"Arne"

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Edradour - 10 Year Old - Straight from the cask
DESCRIPTION:
Edradours story is most certainly one of a kind. It is owned by a gentleman called Andrew Symington who also owns the independent bottling company Signatory. Even the Mafia, Frank Costello was a representative of the company.
Straight from the cask, a limited run at 980 bottles and was bottled in June 2015 after being matured in sherry butt No. 443.
This is a 50cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old The Commonwealth #6702
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2004 and bottled in 2017 this single cask is part of Highland Parks most famous bottling run.  
This single cask was number #6702 and produced 571 bottles. It was a first-fill American Oak Sherry Puncheon. 
Cask Strength: 64.8%
"The Commonwealth"

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Single Cask Series Freydis #3346
DESCRIPTION:
One in the large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery, Highland Park.
This bottling was distilled in 2002 and bottled in 2017. It was done for Freydis (Total Wine).
Matured for 15 years in a Refill Sherry Butt cask number #3346.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Single Cask Series Sydäntalvi #2155
DESCRIPTION:
One in the large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery Highland Park. This specific bottling was done for the Finnish Sydäntalvi. It was distilled in 2001 and bottled in 2017. Only 576 bottles were produced from the single cask #2155.
It was an American Oak Sherry Butt that the whisky was aged for 15 years. 
Cask Strength: 61.3%

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Single Cask Series DFS #3822
DESCRIPTION:
One in a large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery Highland Park.
This bottling was done for DFS - Masters of Wines and Spirits.
It was distilled in 2003 and bottled in 2018. Matured for 15 years in cask #3822 which was a 1st fill American Oak Sherry Puncheon. 
59% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Brucihladdich - 10 Year Old - Single Cask 1525 - Uisge Luing
DESCRIPTION:
This 10 Year Old Bruichladdich is a privately bottled single cask limited to only 290 bottles, each individually numbered by hand. Matured in a Rivesaltes hogshead (#1525) and bottled at 58.5% abv, it's described as 'Hebridean Heaven'.
This is bottle number 171.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfarclas - 21 Years Old - Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland
DESCRIPTION:
Glenfarclas 21 Year Old is one of the most iconic Speyside drams - it is seen as a classic by many. It is heavily sherried dram, rich and full-bodied making it rank right up there with the best of Speyside malts.
This release of Glenfarclas 21 Year old for the Independent Whisky Bars of Scotland was bottled at 47.9%, opposed to 43% that the 21 Year Old is typically bottled at. This is one of 227 individually numbered bottles released.
This is bottle number 169.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

Highland Parks last batch of the 18 Year Old single malt before the new packaging of the 18 Year Old Viking Pride.
756 bottles were hand signed by Whisky Makers Max McFarlane and Gordon Motion.

Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from barrel #120.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Inchgower- 15 Year Old (2000) Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 646 bottles charged from a refill sherry butt ref: HL11883.
At 15 Years Old, this single cask was distilled in October 2000 and bottled in October 2015. This release was specially cask bottled for the Malt Circle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Years Old - Single Cask Series Aberdeen Airport #3631
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park Single Cask Edition was bottled in 2018 exclusively for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies.  With just 610 bottles available, the 12-year-old single malt whisky is drawn from an intriguing mix of American/Spanish oak cask and bottled at a cask strength 64.4% ABV.

This Highland malt has been maturing for over 12 years at the Linkwood distillery
It was produced for 'John McEwan & Co' which was in Leith Scotland.

Highland Park Sigurd was originally a Travel Retail Exclusive and was released as part of the warrior series.  It was partially matured in European oak. It is named after a legendary hero of Norse mythology.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old - Viking Pride - Travel Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Viking Pride by Highland Park is an 18 year old single malt.
This bottle has been bottled at its marrying strength of 46%.
For Viking Pride, Highland Parks Master Whisky Maker Gordon Motion carefully selects up to 120 casks which have matured for 18 years or longer and marries them together, the flavours slowly combine and gather depth and consistency.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 22nd of March 2006.  It was then bottled from a single first fill, sherry butt on the 30th July 2018.  This is one of only 828 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
 
Bottle number 122.

This 16 year old Scapa is part of the Distillery Reserve Collection from Chivas Brothers' single malt whisky.  This was distilled on 6th Feb 2002 and bottled from the casks above.  It was bottled at cask strength at 50.9%% abv.  
This is one of 1644 bottles produced. This is a 50cl bottling.

Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

A limited edition and a 21 year old expression from Glasgow's Auchentoshan distillery.
It has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 5 Year Old Guaranteed Wee Beastie 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A monster of a dram! This young and intensely smokey dram is said to be so fierce it wrecks everything in its path! This is the first new single malt since 2019 Traigh Bhan 19YO.  There are lots of things in this world that cannot be explained and one is said to be the fierce bite that emerges from the peat bogs of Islay.
Both ex bourbon and Oloroso sherry butts have been used to make this special little guy and Ardbegs soon-to-retire distillery manager, Mickey Heads words describe it best: “A new permanent expression in the core range is always momentous for the Distillery, but Wee Beastie is a particularly special dram. As it’s a younger whisky, it means we’re able to get as close to the still as possible. So it’s safe to say this is a ferociously good wee nip!”
So fierce that Ardbeg had to warm all of the enthusiasts of its nature with a Red bottle top for danger...

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 16th December 2001.  It was then bottled from a single first fill barrel on the 4th of May 2017.  This is one of only 312 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
 
This is bottle number 144.

Johnnie Walker Blue label is a super luxury blended whisky and one of the most famous. It is a big flavoured whisky that reflects the Walker family's belief that neither whisky age alone, nor whisky from a single location, is enough to achieve the creation of an unrivalled masterpiece today.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Three Drinkers Scotch Whisky - 17 Year Old - Cask Selection No. 1
DESCRIPTION: Produced by the hosts of Amazon Prime TV show The Three Drinkers, Aidy Smith, Helena Nicklin and Colin Hampden-White. The Three Drinkers Scotch Whisky Cask Selection No. 1 is a 17 year old blend, with flavour elements inspired by their journey around Scotland. The back label of each bottle has been signed by the trio!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #2115 - Highland Park Appreciation Society
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Highland Park Appreciation Society.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #2115 at the cask strength of 59.1% ABV.  With only 576 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.
Originally released in the 1990s for the duty-free market this cask strength bottling of Aberlour 100 Proof was bottled at 57.1% ABV.

Dalmore’s trademark style is luscious notes of orange, chocolate and spices, and the 18 Year Old bottling is a terrific example. Aged in both bourbon and sherry casks, it has seductive notes of vanilla, dark chocolate and candied orange on the nose, followed by a full-bodied, spicy palate of cinnamon and stewed fruit.

This Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1985 before being bottled 15 years later. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch D.SK.312

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Single Cask Series Sydäntalvi #2155
DESCRIPTION:
One in the large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery Highland Park. This specific bottling was done for the Finnish Sydäntalvi. It was distilled in 2001 and bottled in 2017. Only 576 bottles were produced from the single cask #2155.
It was an American Oak Sherry Butt that the whisky was aged for 15 years. 
Cask Strength: 61.3%

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #2115 - Highland Park Appreciation Society

The fixed lights were no longer suitable for the great landfill and then were replaced by installation of group flashing lights, only 1 light is still operational.

Inaugural releases have been hugely popular at the moment and this one is bound to follow suit.

The Spirit of Speyside Festival, in the heart of Scotland, occurs annually and hosts people that travel from all over the world to visit and partake in distillery tours & tastings.
Mortlach released this bottle for the Spirit of Speyside Festival 2013, which is a limited edition and a combination of hand-picked casks to represent the special aspects of Mortlach.

Still clinching onto the title of the most Northern distillery on the mainland UK, Wolfburn has exploded back into the whisky scene in 2013. 
This series "Kylver" is named after an ancient burial stone. This third release is possibly the most anticipated yet and means thorn or grant. 
It has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads before being bottled in 2017.
Label: A commissioned Thurisaz in Repose by Ian Giles.

The ten-year-old Edradour is handmade and one of the last Single Malt Whiskies from a traditional farm distillery still in production today. This is an early release of Edradour 10 Year Old from the 1980s.
Edradour story is most certainly one of a kind. It is owned by a gentleman called Andrew Symington who also owns the independent bottling company Signatory. Even the Mafia, Frank Costello was a representative of the company.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 16 Year Old Sauternes Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Aged for a total of 16 years, this dram started off maturing in a bourbon barrel. After which it was finished in Chateau D'Yquem Premier Cru Superior Sauternes wine barrels.
Benriach is well known for a large number of wood finishes. How does this rank with others you have tased?

One of the largest independent whisky producers, this distillery from Speyside is still well and truly in the family. Run since 1860 from the Grants family, the name of the distillery means the valley of the green grass. 
This unique set with two glasses comes with their great 15 year old expression.

Tusail is the sixth entry in Glenmorangie's Private Collection.  Made using traditionally floor-malted Maris Otter barley, this is an old-fashioned whisky backed up by Glenmorangie's modern approach to whisky-making.

Matured in American Oak casks this malt was aged for 14 years.
Since 2002, the distillery has dedicated one week each year to run heavily peated barley through the whisky-making process creating a distinctly different Balvenie.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 14 Year Old Single Cask King's Royal Hussars 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
Founded by the Grant family in 1898, the distillery was closed for 65 years.
The floor was in fact used by Longmorn distillery for the maltings right next door. Since then it can pride itself in winning 'Distillery of the Year' from Malt Advocate magazine in 2007.
Bottled for The King's Royal Hussars and was distilled in 1997. Only 350 bottles were produced from Maderia Cask number 7592 before bottling in December 2011.
This is bottle number 188.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Foursquare - 14 Year Old Empery Single Rum

The Seale family own the Foursquare distillery where you can trace their roots back to the 1650's in Barbados. At least 5 generations of Rum making masters have come before and their skills have been used many years before the formation of the foursquare brand. 
Foursquare would be seen as one if not the leading forces in the Rum industry and we don't believe that will change.
This fine Basian fine rum is part of the exceptional single cask range Mark IX.
Labelled Empery, this is a single blended rum. Aged for 14 years in ex bourbon and ex-sherry casks. This bottling was released in December 2018.

A limited edition from Wolfburn Distillery to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the end of The First World War.  A total of 1918 bottles were produced and sold exclusively from the distillery and through the Carnegie Whisky Cellars in Dornoch.  This project is important to both companies and was proposed to Wolfburn Distillery due to the owners of Wolfburn being former British Servicemen and the importance of the Poppy Appeal to all service personnel and their families.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.
Aberlour 16 Year Old was double matured in traditional oak casks and fine sherry casks. This double maturation has created a depth of character.

Only 2,000 bottles were released and only 1,200 were sold in the UK. This bottling is a result of independent distillers coming together - Arran, BenRiach, Bladnoch, Glendronach, Glengyle, Kilchoman and Springbank.
It was done to raise monies for the victim's families and refugees of the Japan earthquake which occurred in 2011. 
It was made available from Royal Mile whiskies, Loch Fyne Whiskies, Shinanoya Shokuhin and Kawachiya Shuhan.

Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.
